alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Etowah; Shelby; St. Clair; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 4:24AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Talladega, western Calhoun, northeastern Shelby, southeastern Etowah and central St. Clair Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 424 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rainbow City to near Vandiver. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Talladega, Pell City, Moody, Rainbow City, Attalla, Hokes Bluff, Lincoln, Glencoe, Ashville, Riverside, Vincent, Ragland, Ohatchee, Steele, Reece City, Alpine Bay Resort, Bald Rock, Talladega Superspeedway and Harrisburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Etowah; Shelby; St. Clair; Talladega
